message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the design of erasure codes for distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several CS sub-fields such as information theory (cs.IT), distributed systems (cs.DS), data structures (cs.DS), signal processing (cs.SI), and networking (cs.NI). The use of Hadamard matrices to achieve perfect interference alignment is a signal processing technique, which suggests that cs.SI is a likely sub-category. The focus on minimizing communication and achieving optimal repair properties suggests that cs.IT and cs.DS are also likely sub-categories. The use of finite fields and extensions suggests that cs.DC is a possible sub-category. Finally, the connection to permutation-matrix based codes suggests that cs.NI is a possible sub-category as well.
